maui.main
Class MauiTopicExtractor

java.lang.Object
  maui.main.MauiTopicExtractor
All Implemented Interfaces:
weka.core.OptionHandler
public class MauiTopicExtractor
extends java.lang.Object
implements weka.core.OptionHandler

Extracts topics from the documents in a given directory. Assumes that the file names for the documents end with ".txt". Puts extracted topics into corresponding files ending with ".key" (if those are not already present). Optionally an encoding for the documents/keyphrases can be defined (e.g. for Chinese text). Documents for which ".key" exists are used for evaluation. Valid options are:

-l "directory name"
Specifies name of directory.

-m "model name"
Specifies name of model.

-v "vocabulary name"
Specifies name of vocabulary.

-f "vocabulary format"
Specifies format of vocabulary (text or skos).

-i "document language"
Specifies document language (en, es, de, fr).

-e "encoding"
Specifies encoding.

-w "WikipediaDatabase@WikipediaServer"
Specifies wikipedia data.

-n
Specifies number of phrases to be output (default: 5).

-t "name of class implementing stemmer"
Sets stemmer to use (default: SremovalStemmer).

-s "name of class implementing stopwords"
Sets stemmer to use (default: StopwordsEnglish).

-d
Turns debugging mode on.

-g
Build global dictionaries from the test set.

-p
Prints plain-text graph description of the topics for visual representation of the results.

-a
Also write stemmed phrase and score into ".key" file.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Eibe Frank (eibe@cs.waikato.ac.nz)

setOptions

public void setOptions(java.lang.String[] options)
                throws java.lang.Exception
Parses a given list of options controlling the behaviour of this object. Valid options are:

-l "directory name"
Specifies name of directory.

-m "model name"
Specifies name of model.

-v "vocabulary name"
Specifies vocabulary name.

-f "vocabulary format"
Specifies vocabulary format.

-i "document language"
Specifies document language.

-e "encoding"
Specifies encoding.

-w "WikipediaDatabase@WikipediaServer"
Specifies wikipedia data.

-n
Specifies number of phrases to be output (default: 5).

-d
Turns debugging mode on.

-b
Builds global dictionaries for computing TFxIDF from the test collection.

-a
Also write stemmed phrase and score into ".key" file.

Specified by:
setOptions in interface weka.core.OptionHandler
Parameters:

computeGraph

public void computeGraph(java.util.HashMap<org.wikipedia.miner.model.Article,java.lang.Integer> topics,
                         java.lang.String root,
                         java.lang.String outputFile)
Prints out a plain-text representation of a graph representing the main topics of the document. The nodes are the topics and the edges are relations between them as computed using the Wikipedia Miner. Only possible if Wikipedia data is provided.

Parameters:
topics -
root -
outputFile -
